newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft's Gates sees NT update by mid-98.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft's Gates sees NT update by mid-98.

text.p: Microsoft Corp Chairman Bill Gates Wednesday said he expects version 5.0 of the company's Windows NT operating system to be released in the first half of 1998.
"We've said that it will be in the first half of 1998, and I'd say we're pretty confident about that," Gates said in a brief interview on CNBC.
"We're always going to listen to the customer feedback about the features and the reliability," he said. "Until a software product ships it's always fair to say that it could be later."
Earlier this month Gates and other Microsoft officials said they expected Windows NT 5.0 to be released in early 1998 rather than in 1997 as previously expected.
Gates said the software giant is just beginning to get beta test versions of the product into customer hands.

The new version of the high-end operating system will include a number of changes including features intended to make computers less expensive for businesses to operate dubbed Zero Admninistration Windows.
